title: IDE ‚Üî Noted ‚Üî AI Agent Documentation Pipeline
subtitle: Use Noted as communication layer between developer, IDE, and AI agents

overview.description: Transform Noted into a central knowledge hub where developers write documentation in their IDE, notes automatically sync to Noted app, and AI agents (like Claude Code) can read/write to the same knowledge base using RAG. Enables persistent agent memory and living documentation.
overview.core_concept: Noted becomes the 'shared brain' between human developers and AI agents
overview.key_innovation: Agent has persistent access to project context without developer repeating information every session
target_users: Developers using Claude Code or similar AI coding assistants
Teams wanting shared documentation accessible to both humans and AI
Solo developers building complex projects with AI assistance

current_state: AI agents have no memory between sessions
Developer must repeat project context every time
Documentation lives separate from agent workflow
Agent-generated docs don't persist anywhere useful
No feedback loop: agent learns ‚Üí documents ‚Üí developer corrects ‚Üí agent relearns
pain_points: Context switching: leave IDE ‚Üí open separate docs ‚Üí copy/paste
Lost context: agent forgets decisions from previous sessions
Manual documentation: developer must write everything agent figures out
Scattered knowledge: project info across Notion, Slack, code comments, etc.

the_solution.architecture: Three-way real-time sync: IDE ‚Üî Noted ‚Üî AI Agent
data_flow: Developer writes/edits notes in IDE (VS Code, Cursor, etc.)
IDE extension syncs changes to Noted app via API
Agent queries Noted via RAG when user asks questions
Agent can write new notes back to Noted
New notes appear in IDE automatically
benefits: Agent has persistent project knowledge across sessions
Living documentation that both humans and AI maintain
Context automatically available to agent (no copy/paste)
Agent documents its work ‚Üí developer reviews in IDE
Single source of truth for project knowledge
Collaboration between human and AI made seamless

components.ide_extension: VS Code extension monitoring project files
components.noted_api: Supabase REST API + custom Edge Functions
components.rag_system: Vector embeddings + semantic search (from RAG plan)
components.agent_interface: API methods for agents to read/write notes

use_case_1_agent_learns_from_docs.title: Agent learns project context from developer's notes
scenario: 1. Developer creates `/docs/architecture.md` in project
2. IDE extension syncs to Noted app
3. Noted generates embedding (RAG)
4. Developer asks agent: 'How does authentication work?'
5. Agent queries RAG ‚Üí finds architecture.md
6. Agent answers based on YOUR documentation
7. No need to repeat context every session
use_case_1_agent_learns_from_docs.value: Agent has persistent memory of project decisions

use_case_2_agent_documents_work.title: Agent documents implementation decisions as it works
scenario: 1. Developer: 'Implement user authentication'
2. Agent implements auth system
3. Agent creates note 'Auth Implementation.md' via API
4. Note syncs to Noted app
5. Note appears in IDE sidebar automatically
6. Developer reviews agent's documentation
7. Developer makes corrections in IDE
8. Changes sync back to Noted
9. Agent sees updates on next query
use_case_2_agent_documents_work.value: Living documentation maintained by both human and AI

use_case_3_team_knowledge_base.title: Shared knowledge base for team + AI
scenario: 1. Team members write docs in their IDEs
2. All docs sync to central Noted workspace
3. Any team member's agent can query all docs
4. Agent A learns from what Agent B documented
5. Consistent context across entire team
6. New team member: agent reads all docs instantly
use_case_3_team_knowledge_base.value: Single source of truth accessible by humans and AI

use_case_4_iterative_refinement.title: Iterative documentation refinement loop
scenario: 1. Agent generates initial API design doc
2. Developer reviews in IDE, adds corrections
3. Agent reads updated doc
4. Agent refines implementation based on corrections
5. Agent updates doc with final decisions
6. Developer approves ‚Üí doc becomes reference
7. Future queries use refined doc

use_case_5_context_persistence.title: Agent remembers across coding sessions
scenario: Day 1: Agent helps design database schema
Agent writes 'Database Schema.md'
Day 2: New session, developer asks about tables
Agent queries RAG ‚Üí reads yesterday's doc
Agent remembers schema without being told
Day 3: Schema changes, developer updates doc
Agent automatically sees new version
use_case_5_context_persistence.value: Agent context persists days, weeks, months

phase_1_vs_code_extension_foundation.description: Build basic VS Code extension that syncs markdown files to Noted
deliverables: VS Code extension package (TypeScript)
File watcher for project /docs folder or .noted/ folder
One-way sync: IDE ‚Üí Noted (create/update notes)
Authentication via API key stored in VS Code settings
Status bar indicator (synced/syncing/error)

api_calls: POST /api/notes/sync - Create or update note from file
DELETE /api/notes/{id} - Delete note when file removed
technical_details.file_watching: Use VS Code workspace.createFileSystemWatcher to monitor *.md files
technical_details.sync_strategy: Debounce file changes (500ms) to avoid excessive API calls

setup_flow.step_1: User installs 'Noted Sync' extension from VS Code marketplace
setup_flow.step_2: Extension prompts for Noted API key (from app settings)
setup_flow.step_4: Extension scans folder and uploads existing .md files

user_settings.noted.apiKey: User's API key from Noted app
user_settings.noted.syncOnSave: Sync immediately on save vs debounced (default: true)

phase_2_noted_api_sync_endpoints.description: Add API endpoints to Noted backend for IDE sync operations
deliverables: New Supabase Edge Function: ide-sync
API routes for create/update/delete notes from IDE
Special note metadata: synced_from_ide: boolean, ide_file_path: string
Rate limiting (100 requests/minute per user)
Webhook support (optional for phase 2)

routes: POST /ide-sync/create - Create new note from IDE file
DELETE /ide-sync/delete/{id} - Delete note (file removed in IDE)
GET /ide-sync/list - List all IDE-synced notes for user
GET /ide-sync/status - Check sync status and last sync time

changes: ALTER TABLE notes ADD COLUMN synced_from_ide BOOLEAN DEFAULT FALSE;
ALTER TABLE notes ADD COLUMN ide_file_path TEXT;
ALTER TABLE notes ADD COLUMN last_ide_sync_at TIMESTAMP;
CREATE INDEX idx_notes_ide_synced ON notes(user_id, synced_from_ide) WHERE synced_from_ide = TRUE;

technical_details.authentication: Use existing user_api_keys table, validate API key in Edge Function
technical_details.rate_limiting: Use Supabase Edge Function rate limiting (100 req/min)

phase_3_two_way_sync.description: Enable Noted ‚Üí IDE sync (agent writes, developer sees in IDE)
deliverables: IDE extension polls Noted API for updates
New notes created in Noted appear in IDE
Note edits in Noted update IDE files
Conflict detection and resolution UI
Merge conflict markers (similar to git)

polling_strategy.method: Poll Noted API every 10 seconds for updates
polling_strategy.optimization: Only fetch notes modified after last sync

conflict_detection.scenario: Note edited in both IDE and Noted app simultaneously
resolution_options: Show diff and let user merge
conflict_detection.ui: VS Code diff editor showing both versions side-by-side

file_updates.strategy: Write to IDE file system using VS Code workspace API
file_updates.notification: Show toast: 'architecture.md updated by Noted app'
file_updates.editor_behavior: If file open in editor, show reload prompt

phase_4_agent_integration_layer.description: Enable AI agents to read/write notes via API
deliverables: Agent API client library (TypeScript/Python)
Methods: queryNotes(), createNote(), updateNote()
Integration with RAG system (query by semantic meaning)
Agent authentication via service account or user delegation
Usage examples and documentation

methods: queryNotes(query: string, options?: QueryOptions): Promise<Note[]> - Semantic search via RAG
createNote(title: string, content: string, metadata?: NoteMetadata): Promise<Note>
generateEmbedding(content: string): Promise<number[]> - For custom RAG implementations

rag_integration.requirement: RAG system must be implemented (see rag-ask-your-notes-implementation.json)
workflow: 1. Agent calls queryNotes('how does authentication work?')
4. Client returns top K relevant notes
5. Agent reads notes and formulates answer

option_1_user_delegation.description: Agent acts on behalf of user
option_1_user_delegation.flow: User grants agent access to their Noted account via OAuth

option_2_service_account.description: Agent has its own Noted account
option_2_service_account.flow: Create special 'agent' user with API key

option_3_project_api_key.flow: User generates project-specific API key in Noted, adds to .env

phase_5_ide_sidebar_panel.description: Add VS Code sidebar panel for managing synced notes
deliverables: Custom sidebar view in VS Code
Tree view of all synced notes
Quick actions: open, sync, create new note
Sync status indicators
Search/filter notes

methods: refresh(): void - Reload tree from API

phase_6_real_time_collaboration.description: Replace polling with real-time WebSocket updates
deliverables: WebSocket connection between IDE and Noted
Live updates when agent writes new note
Live updates when note edited in Noted app
Operational transforms for simultaneous edits (advanced)
Presence indicators (who's editing what)

websocket_implementation.client: VS Code extension subscribes to note changes

real_time_events: note_created - New note added by agent/app

operational_transforms.description: Advanced conflict resolution for simultaneous edits
operational_transforms.library: Use Yjs or Automerge for CRDT-based merging
operational_transforms.complexity: High - consider for Phase 7 or later

noted_backend.modifications: Add ide_sync metadata to notes table

create_note_flow: 1. Developer creates docs/auth.md in VS Code
6. Edge Function inserts note into notes table
8. Edge Function returns note ID + sync status
agent_query_flow: 1. User asks agent: 'How does auth work?'
5. Edge Function searches notes via vector similarity
6. Edge Function returns top 5 relevant notes
7. Agent reads notes and formulates answer
8. Agent responds to user with info from notes
agent_create_flow: 4. Edge Function creates note with synced_from_ide=false
7. Extension writes new file to docs/impl-notes.md
8. VS Code shows notification: 'New note from agent'

security_considerations: API keys stored in VS Code secure storage (not plain text)
API keys scoped to project (not global user access)
Rate limiting on all sync endpoints
No execution of code from synced files
performance_optimizations: Debounce file changes (500ms) to avoid excessive syncs
Batch sync multiple file changes into single API call
Cache note metadata locally (reduce API calls)
Lazy load embeddings (don't block sync on embedding generation)

setup: 1. Install VS Code extension from marketplace
4. Developer generates API key in Noted app settings
5. Paste API key into VS Code extension
7. Extension scans and uploads existing notes
daily_use: Developer writes docs in /docs folder as normal
Every save auto-syncs to Noted (no manual action)
Status bar always shows sync status
Sidebar panel shows list of synced notes
If agent creates new note, notification appears
Click notification to open new file in editor
conflict_handling: Extension detects conflict (edited in both places)
Shows VS Code diff editor with both versions
Developer chooses: keep local, keep remote, or merge
After resolution, extension syncs final version

reading_docs: Agent cites source notes in response

vs_notion_api.noted_advantage: Built-in RAG, designed for AI agents from ground up
vs_notion_api.notion_limitation: No native RAG, complex API, slow for real-time sync

vs_obsidian_sync.noted_advantage: Cloud-first with RAG, multi-device, agent-friendly API
vs_obsidian_sync.obsidian_limitation: Local-first, no RAG, limited agent integration

vs_github_wiki.noted_advantage: Real-time IDE sync, RAG queries, richer formatting
vs_github_wiki.github_limitation: Manual git workflow, no RAG, no AI agent integration

vs_confluence.confluence_limitation: Enterprise bloat, slow, not designed for code projects

open_source_strategy.approach: Open source the VS Code extension, keep backend proprietary
rationale: Extension code benefits from community contributions
Backend API is core value (keep proprietary)
Open source extension builds trust and adoption
Community can add features and fix bugs

challenge_1_file_conflicts.problem: Note edited in both IDE and Noted app simultaneously
challenge_1_file_conflicts.solution: Three-way merge with visual diff editor
challenge_1_file_conflicts.mitigation: Start with last-write-wins, add advanced merge later

challenge_2_large_files.solution: Chunk large files, only sync changed chunks
challenge_2_large_files.mitigation: Set file size limit (1MB) for MVP

challenge_3_performance.problem: Syncing 1000+ notes on initial setup takes minutes
challenge_3_performance.solution: Background batch sync with progress indicator
challenge_3_performance.mitigation: Show progress bar, allow background sync

challenge_4_auth_security.problem: API keys must be secure but easy to use
challenge_4_auth_security.solution: Use VS Code secure storage API
challenge_4_auth_security.mitigation: Never store in plain text, use encryption
